title: A Novel Real-Time Adaptive Learning Network Using Dynamic Feedback Mechanisms for Enhanced Performance in Time-Sensitive Applications
venue: 2025 1st International Conference on Radio Frequency Communication and Networks (RFCoN)
abstract: A novel Real-Time Adaptive Learning Network (RTALN) using deep learning architecture is developed in this paper to enhance performance through continuous real-time feedback mechanisms. The RTALN integrates convolutional (Conv1D) and recurrent neural network (LSTM) layers with self-attention mechanisms and a reinforcement learning agent (Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient) to process and adapt to streaming data efficiently. Evaluated on the MIMIC-III Waveform Database for real-time physiological monitoring, RTALN achieved an accuracy of 99.12%, precision of 99.06%, recall of 99.4%, and F1 score of 99.1%. For anomaly detection using the HDFS Log Dataset, it achieved a precision of 99.5% and recall of 99.3%. The feedback loop operates with a latency of less than 100 milliseconds, ensuring near-instantaneous adaptation. Additionally, an intuitive dashboard, developed using Grafana, visualizes key performance indicators and adaptive changes in real-time. The RTALN sets a new benchmark in adaptive learning, particularly for time-sensitive applications such as healthcare monitoring, where immediate and accurate responses are crucial.
